history.content:
very doable

-------------------

Maybe the projects will be annoying sometimes but overall yeah it is pretty doable.

children.subject: could i get some tips on how to manage that lol? Do you just manage to start all your projects as soon as they're released so you don't have to cram too much before the deadline? Also how long/intensive are 186 projects?

I'll speak from my experience, although you might find it to be very different.

I find 188 projects to be the most straightforward, and typically finish them in one long sitting. For the very first wave of 186's 2nd project which was considerably longer than the first and 161's 1st project both being due on the same day, I did them both solo and also started a bit late, and it resulted in a stressful, stressful week or 2 and having to use about 6 slip days combined across the 2 classes. Having partners to work with helps a lot now, and if 186 and 161 projects are due the same week, I try to finish one of the projects the week before,

I think the 186 projects were the biggest surprise and something I had underestimated after the first project was pretty easy, which made the beginning kind of rough. From a reddit user (which I find to be pretty accurate):

How long I think I spent on projects: Project 1 SQL: 7-10 hrs Project 2 index and tree: 12-15 hrs Project 3 iterations and joins (2 parts): 23-25 hrs Project 4 Locking (2 parts): 27-30 hrs Project 5 recovery ~20 hrs

The two big projects to watch out for are cs161's proj2 and cs186's proj4, which also happen to be due a week apart this semester.

If you want to talk about it a bit more, well idk maybe leave an email or something. but hopefully this helps
Yeah that helps a lot. Thanks for taking the time

that's actually the exact courseload i have this semester, lol.

The workload can be pretty uneven and there were one or two times where all 3 projects were due on the same day which wasn't very fun, but overall it's pretty manageable (imo).

I'm a TA for one of those classes and I also took this exact schedule. I felt every week I would do a round robin of which class to fall behind in. That being said, all three classes are very well ran and organized, just sometimes there isn't enough time in the day to be super caught up on all three :')

history.content: Is cs188, cs161, and cs186 a heavy courseload for next semster? Is it doable or should i switch out a class?
history.subject: Course Load Advice
